microsoft.sql/servers/databases.Description: Cloud adoption for an Enterprise, small or large, require responsible and efficient governance models to derive value from their cloud deployments. CloudWise (a code-name for the solution), is a composite solution available from Azure Partner QuickStarts, is an adoption enabler for Customers, System Integrators and Partners alike, that delivers a self-serviceable, automated governance and operations solution, focused on Optimizing Your Costs, Improve Your Application(s) Reliability, Reducing Business Risk. The solution highlights the core governance pillars of Visibility and Control.

microsoft.sql/servers/databases.Title: Deploy the Sports Analytics on Azure Architecture
microsoft.sql/servers/databases.Description: Creates an Azure storage account with ADLS Gen 2 enabled, an Azure Data Factory instance with linked services for the storage account (an the Azure SQL Database if deployed), and an Azure Databricks instance. The AAD identity for the user deploying the template and the managed identity for the ADF instance will be granted the Storage Blob Data Contributor role on the storage account. There are also options to deploy an Azure Key Vault instance, an Azure SQL Database, and an Azure Event Hub (for streaming use cases). When an Azure Key Vault is deployed, the data factory managed identity and the AAD identity for the user deploying the template will be granted the Key Vault Secrets User role.

microsoft.sql/servers/databases.Title: Migrate to Azure SQL database using Azure DMS
microsoft.sql/servers/databases.Description: The Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) is designed to streamline the process of migrating on-premises databases to Azure. DMS will simplify the migration of existing on-premises SQL Server and Oracle databases to Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance or Microsoft SQL Server in an Azure Virtual Machine. This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

The first leg of the pipeline leverages data management gateway to pull data from an on-premises SQL server source into Azure Data Lake Store in Apache orc columnar storage format. The second leg of the pipeline pulls data from orc files in Azure Data Lake Store and inserts into Azure SQL as a final destination. This pipeline can be easily customized to accomodated a wide variety of additional sources and targets.

There are also options to deploy an Azure Key Vault instance, an Azure SQL Database, and an Azure Event Hub (for streaming use cases). When an Azure Key Vault is deployed, the data factory managed identity and the AAD identity for the user deploying the template will be granted the Key Vault Secrets User role.

This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

Optimization happens automatically on your subscription once you enable or create your own schedule, including on new resources. This is an Azure Automation account with preconfigured runbooks and schedules you can utilize on your subscription to start saving money.

microsoft.insights/autoscalesettings.Title: Enterprise Governance-AppService, SQL DB, AD, OMS, Runbooks
microsoft.insights/autoscalesettings.Description: Cloud adoption for an Enterprise, small or large, require responsible and efficient governance models to derive value from their cloud deployments. CloudWise (a code-name for the solution), is a composite solution available from Azure Partner QuickStarts, is an adoption enabler for Customers, System Integrators and Partners alike, that delivers a self-serviceable, automated governance and operations solution, focused on Optimizing Your Costs, Improve Your Application(s) Reliability, Reducing Business Risk. The solution highlights the core governance pillars of Visibility and Control.

The example uses a custom script to do the application deployment and update, you may have to provide your custom script for your own update procedure. You will have to provide a generalized image of your VM in the same subscription and region where you create the VMSS.

microsoft.databricks/workspaces.Title: Deploy the Sports Analytics on Azure Architecture
microsoft.databricks/workspaces.Description: Creates an Azure storage account with ADLS Gen 2 enabled, an Azure Data Factory instance with linked services for the storage account (an the Azure SQL Database if deployed), and an Azure Databricks instance. The AAD identity for the user deploying the template and the managed identity for the ADF instance will be granted the Storage Blob Data Contributor role on the storage account. There are also options to deploy an Azure Key Vault instance, an Azure SQL Database, and an Azure Event Hub (for streaming use cases). When an Azure Key Vault is deployed, the data factory managed identity and the AAD identity for the user deploying the template will be granted the Key Vault Secrets User role.

microsoft.datamigration/services.Title: Migrate to Azure SQL database using Azure DMS
microsoft.datamigration/services.Description: The Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) is designed to streamline the process of migrating on-premises databases to Azure. DMS will simplify the migration of existing on-premises SQL Server and Oracle databases to Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance or Microsoft SQL Server in an Azure Virtual Machine. This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

DMS will simplify the migration of existing on-premises SQL Server and Oracle databases to Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance or Microsoft SQL Server in an Azure Virtual Machine. This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

microsoft.network/routetables/routes.Title: VNS3 network appliance for cloud connectivity and security
microsoft.network/routetables/routes.Description: VNS3 is a software only virtual appliance that provides the combined features and functions of a security appliance, application delivery controller and unified threat management device at the cloud application edge. Key benefits, on top of cloud networking, always on end to end encryption, federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, attestable control over encryption keys, meshed network manageable at scale, reliable HA in the cloud, isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, caching, proxy, load balancers and other layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: FrontDoor CDN with WAF, Domains and Logs to EventHub

Create WAF with custom and managed rules, cdn routes, origin and groups with their association with WAF and routes, configures custom domains, create event hub and diagnostic settings for sending CDN access logs using event hub.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Premium with App Service origin and Private Link
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Premium and an App Service, and uses a private endpoint for Front Door to send traffic to the application.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Premium and an Azure Storage blob container, and uses a private endpoint for Front Door to send traffic to the storage account.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Premium with VM and Private Link service
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Premium and a virtual machine configured as a web server. Front Door uses a private endpoint with Private Link service to send traffic to the VM.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with API Management origin
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Premium and an API Management instance, and uses an NSG and global API Management policy to validate that traffic has come through the Front Door origin.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium, an App Service, and configures the App Service to validate that traffic has come through the Front Door origin.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium and an Application Gateway instance, and uses an NSG and WAF policy to validate that traffic has come through the Front Door origin.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door with Container Instances and Application Gateway
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium with a container group and Application Gateway.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with Azure Container Instances
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium with a container group.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with custom domain
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a custom domain and Microsoft-managed certificate.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a custom domain on Azure DNS and Microsoft-managed certificate.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with domain and certificate
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a custom domain and customer-managed certificate.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with Azure Functions origin
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium, an Azure Functions app, and configures the function app to validate that traffic has come through the Front Door origin.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a rule set.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Front Door Standard/Premium with WAF and custom rule
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template creates a Front Door Standard/Premium including a web application firewall with a custom rule.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Function App secured by Azure Frontdoor
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template allows you to deploy an azure premium function protected and published by Azure Frontdoor premium. The conenction between Azure Frontdoor and Azure Functions is protected by Azure Private Link.

microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Title: Highly Available Multi-region Web App
microsoft.cdn/profiles/origingroups/orig.Description: This template allows you to create a secure, highly available, multi-region end to end solution with two web apps in different regions behind Azure Front Door

microsoft.apimanagement/service/diagnost.Title: Create API Management in Internal VNet with App Gateway
microsoft.apimanagement/service/diagnost.Description: This template demonstrates how to Create a instance of Azure API Management on a private network protected by Azure Application Gateway.

microsoft.apimanagement/service/diagnost.Title: Application Gateway with internal API Management and Web App
microsoft.apimanagement/service/diagnost.Description: Application Gateway routing Internet traffic to a virtual network (internal mode) API Management instance which services a web API hosted in an Azure Web App.

microsoft.streamanalytics/streamingjobs.Title: Create a Standard Stream Analytics Job
microsoft.streamanalytics/streamingjobs.Description: This template creates a Standard Stream Analytics Job. For more information, Azure Stream Analytics is a real-time analytics and complex event-processing engine that is designed to analyze and process high volumes of fast streaming data from multiple sources simultaneously. Patterns and relationships can be identified in information extracted from a number of input sources including devices, sensors, clickstreams, social media feeds, and applications. These patterns can be used to trigger actions and initiate workflows such creating alerts, feeding information to a reporting tool, or storing transformed data for later use. Also, Stream Analytics is available on Azure IoT Edge runtime, and supports the same exact language or syntax as cloud.

microsoft.signalrservice/webpubsub.Title: Create Azure Web PubSub by using Bicep
microsoft.signalrservice/webpubsub.Description: Azure Web PubSub Service helps you build real-time messaging web applications using WebSockets and the publish-subscribe pattern. This uses Bicep language to create and configure a Web PubSub resource. You can use this template to conveniently deploy Web PubSub for a tutorial or testing, or as a building block for more complex deployments with Web PubSub.

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: SharePoint Subscription / 2019 / 2016 fully configured
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: Create a DC, a SQL Server 2022, and from 1 to 5 server(s) hosting a SharePoint Subscription / 2019 / 2016 farm with an extensive configuration, including trusted authentication, user profiles with personal sites, an OAuth trust (using a certificate), a dedicated IIS site for hosting high-trust add-ins, etc... The latest version of key softwares (including Fiddler, vscode, np++, 7zip, ULS Viewer) is installed. SharePoint machines have additional fine-tuning to make them immediately usable (remote administration tools, custom policies for Edge and Chrome, shortcuts, etc...).

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Use Azure Firewall as a DNS Proxy in a Hub & Spoke topology
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This sample show how to deploy a hub-spoke topology in Azure using the Azure Firewall. The hub virtual network acts as a central point of connectivity to many spoke virtual networks that are connected to hub virtual network via virtual network peering.

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Create a Firewall and FirewallPolicy with Rules and Ipgroups
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This template deploys an Azure Firewall with Firewall Policy (including multiple application and network rules) referencing IP Groups in application and network rules.

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Create a Firewall, FirewallPolicy with Explicit Proxy
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This template creates an Azure Firewall, FirewalllPolicy with Explicit Proxy and Network Rules with IpGroups. Also, includes a Linux Jumpbox vm setup

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Create a Firewall with FirewallPolicy and IpGroups
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This template creates an Azure Firewall with FirewalllPolicy referencing Network Rules with IpGroups. Also, includes a Linux Jumpbox vm setup

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Testing environment for Azure Firewall Premium
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This template creates an Azure Firewall Premium and Firewall Policy with premium features such as Intrusion Inspection Detection (IDPS), TLS inspection and Web Category filtering

microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Title: Secured virtual hubs
microsoft.network/firewallpolicies/rulec.Description: This template creates a secured virtual hub using Azure Firewall to secure your cloud network traffic destined to the Internet.

microsoft.appplatform/spring/apps/deploy.Title: Deploy a simple Azure Spring Apps microservice application
microsoft.appplatform/spring/apps/deploy.Description: This template deploys a simple Azure Spring Apps microservice application to run on Azure.

microsoft.network/dnsforwardingrulesets/.Title: Azure DNS Private Resolver
microsoft.network/dnsforwardingrulesets/.Description: This template provisions Azure DNS Private Resolver in a virtual network with required forwarding ruleset and rules. It creates a new virtual network with two subnets, and deploy Azure DNS Private Resolver in this VNET.

microsoft.insights/workbooks.Title: FinOps toolkit workbook
microsoft.insights/workbooks.Description: This template creates a new Azure Monitor workbook for governance.

microsoft.insights/workbooks.Title: Cost optimization workbook
microsoft.insights/workbooks.Description: This template creates a new Azure Monitor workbook for cost optimization based on the Well-Architected Framework.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Linux VM and update private IP to static
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Linux VM using Ubuntu from the marketplace. This will deploy a VNET, Subnet, and an A1 size VM in the resource group location with a dynamically assigned IP address and then convert it to static IP.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create VMs in Availability Sets using Resource Loops
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: Create 2-5 VMs in Availability Sets using Resource Loops.  The VMs can be Unbuntu or Windows with a maximum of 5 VMs since this sample uses a single storageAccount

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Multi VM Template with Managed Disk
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will create N number of VM's with managed disks, public IPs and network interfaces. It will create the VMs in a single Availability Set. They will be provisioned in a Virtual Network which will also be created as part of the deployment

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Install a file on a Windows VM
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Windows VM and run a custom PowerShell script to install a file on that VM.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with Custom Data
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with Custom Data passed down to the VM. This template also deploys a Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP addresses and a Network Interface.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Premium Windows VM with diagnostics
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Premium Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM in a VNET in different Resource Group
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VM in a VNET which is in a different Resource Group

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Join a VM to an existing domain
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template demonstrates domain join to a private AD domain up in cloud.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM with a dynamic selection of data disks
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows the user to select the number of data disks they'd like to add to the VM.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM from a EfficientIP VHD
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VM from a EfficientIP VHD and let you connect it to an existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group then the virtual machine

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM from User Image
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machines from a User image. This template also deploys a Virtual Network, Public IP addresses and a Network Interface.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM in a new or existing vnet from a generalized VHD
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VM from a generalized VHD and let you connect it to a new or existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group than the virtual machine

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: CentOS/UbuntuServer Auto Dynamic Disks & Docker 1.12(cs)
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This is a common template for creating single instance CentOS 7.2/7.1/6.5 or Ubuntu Server 16.04.0-LTS with configurable number of data disks (configurable sizes). Maximum 16 disks can be mentioned in the portal parameters and maximum size of each disk should be less than 1023 GB. The MDADM RAID0 Array is automounted and survives restarts. Latest Docker 1.12(cs3) (Swarm), docker-compose 1.9.0 & docker-machine 0.8.2 is available for usage from user azure-cli is auto running as a docker container. This single instance template is an offshoot of the HPC/GPU Clusters Template @ https://github.com/azurebigcompute/BigComputeBench

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: GitLab Omnibus
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template simplifies the deployment of GitLab Omnibus on a Virtual Machine with a public DNS, leveraging the public IP's DNS. It utilizes the Standard_F8s_v2 instance size, which aligns with reference architecture and supports up to 1000 users (20 RPS). The instance is pre-configured to use HTTPS with a Let's Encrypt certificate for secure connections.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Linux VM with Serial Output
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a simple Linux VM with minimal parameters and serial/console configured to output to storage

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM with monitoring and diagnostics
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM along with the diagnostics extension which enables monitoring and diagnostics for the VM

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Linux or Windows VM with MSI
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Linux or Windows VM with a Managed Service Identity.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Terraform on Azure
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Terraform workstation as a Linux VM with MSI.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Linux VM with MSI Accessing Storage
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template deploys a linux VM with a system assigned managed identity that has access to a storage account in a different resource group.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Windows Virtual Machine from a specified image. It also attaches 4 empty data disks. Note that you can specify the size of the empty data disks.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a VM with multiple IPs
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a VM with 3 IP configurations. This template will deploy a Linux/Windows VM called *myVM1* with 3 IP configurations: *IPConfig-1*, *IPConfig-2* and *IPConfig-3*, respectively.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Linux VM (Ubuntu) with multiple NICs
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VNet with multiple subnets and deploys a Ubuntu VM with multiple NICs

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Virtual Machine with Conditional Resources
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows deploying a linux VM using new or existing resources for the Virtual Network, Storage and Public IP Address.  It also allows for choosing between SSH and Password authenticate.  The templates uses conditions and logic functions to remove the need for nested deployments.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create VM from existing VHDs and connect it to existingVNET
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VM from VHDs (OS + data disk) and let you connect it to an existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group then the virtual machine

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Push a certificate onto a Windows VM
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: Push a certificate onto a Windows VM. Create the Key Vault using the template at https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/templates/101-create-key-vault

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Secure VM password with Key Vault
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM by retrieving the password that is stored in a Key Vault. Therefore the password is never put in plain text in the template parameter file

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple FreeBSD VM in resource group location
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple FreeBSD VM using a few different options for the FreeBSD version, using the latest patched version. This will deploy in resource group location on a D1 VM Size.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Ubuntu Linux VM 20.04-LTS
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template deploys an Ubuntu Server with a few options for the VM. You can provide the VM Name, OS Version, VM size, and admin username and password. As default the VM size is Standard_D2s_v3 and OS version is 20.04-LTS.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Linux VM with Accelerated Networking
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Linux VM with Accelerated Networking using Ubuntu version 18.04-LTS with the latest patched version. This will deploy a D3_v2 size VM in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the VM.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8)
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will deploy a Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8), using the Pay-As-You-Go RHEL VM image for the selected version on Standard D1 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8 unmanaged)
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will deploy a Red Hat Enterprise Linux VM (RHEL 7.8), using the Pay-As-You-Go RHEL VM image for the selected version on Standard A1_v2 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server VM (SLES 12)
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will allow you to deploy a SUSE Linux Enterprise Server VM (SLES 12), using the Pay-As-You-Go SLES VM image for the selected version on Standard D1 VM in the location of your chosen resource group with an additional 100 GiB data disk attached to the VM. Additional charges apply to this image - consult Azure VM Pricing page for details.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple Windows VM using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version. This will deploy an A2 size VM in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the VM.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Windows Server VM with Visual Studio
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template deploys a Windows Server VM with Visual Code Studio Community 2019, with a few options for the VM. You can provide the name of VM, the admin username and admin password.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a VM into an Availability Zone
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM (Windows or Ubuntu), using the latest patched version. This will deploy a A2_v2 size VM in the location specified and return the FQDN of the VM.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM in a new or existing vnet from a custom VHD
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a VM from a specialized VHD and let you connect it to a new or existing VNET that can reside in another Resource Group than the virtual machine

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP2 Enterprise with Auto Backup
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP2 Enterprise edition with Auto Backup feature enabled

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise with Auto Patching
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise edition with Auto Patching feature enabled.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise with Azure Key Vault
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will create a SQL Server 2014 SP1 Enterprise edition with Azure Key Vault Integration feature enabled.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with SSH rsa public key
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with SSH rsa public key

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a simple Windows VM with tags
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template will deploy a D2_v3 Windows VM, NIC, Storage Account, Virtual Network, Public IP Address, and Network Security Group. The tag object is created in the variables and will be applied on all resources, where applicable.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a trusted launch capable Linux virtual machine
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a trusted launch capable Linux virtual machine using a few different options for the Linux version, using the latest patched version. If you enable Secureboot and vTPM, the Guest Attestation extension will be installed on your VM. This extension will perform remote [attestation](/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/tpm-fundamentals#measured-boot-with-support-for-attestation) by the cloud. By default, this will deploy an Standard_D2_v3 size virtual machine in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the virtual machine.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a trusted launch capable Windows virtual machine
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a trusted launch capable Windows virtual machine using a few different options for the Windows version, using the latest patched version. If you enable Secureboot and vTPM, the Guest Attestation extension will be installed on your VM. This extension will perform remote [attestation](/windows/security/information-protection/tpm/tpm-fundamentals#measured-boot-with-support-for-attestation) by the cloud. By default, this will deploy an Standard_D2_v3 size virtual machine in the resource group location and return the FQDN of the virtual machine.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Virtual Machine with User Data
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Virtual Machine with User Data passed down to the VM. This template also deploys a Virtual Network, Public IP addresses, and a Network Interface.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Windows VM with Windows Admin Center extension
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a Windows VM with Windows Admin Center extension to manage the VM directly from Azure Portal.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Windows VM with Azure secure baseline
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: The template creates a virtual machine running Windows Server in a new virtual network, with a public IP address. Once the machine has deployed, the guest configuration extension is installed and the Azure secure baseline for Windows Server is applied. If the configuration of the machines drifts, you can re-apply the settings by deploying the template again.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Deploy a Windows VM with a variable number of data disks
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to deploy a simple VM and specify the number of data disks at deploy time using a parameter.  Note that the number and size of data disks is bound by the VM size.  The VM size for this sample is Standard_DS4_v2 with a default of 16 data disks.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Windows Server VM with SSH
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: Deploy a single Windows VM with Open SSH enabled so that you can connect through SSH using key-based authentication.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a data management gateway and install on an Azure VM
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template deploys a virtual machine and creates a workable data management gateway

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Virtual machine with an RDP port
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: Creates a virtual machine and creates a NAT rule for RDP to the VM in load balancer

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Create a VM with multiple empty StandardSSD_LRS Data Disks
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template allows you to create a Windows Virtual Machine from a specified image. It also attaches multiple empty StandardSSD data disks by default. Note that you can specify the size and the Storage type (Standard_LRS, StandardSSD_LRS and Premium_LRS) of the empty data disks.

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Self-host Integration Runtime on Azure VMs
microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Description: This template creates a selfhost integration runtime and registers it on Azure virtual machines

microsoft.compute/virtualmachines.Title: Add multiple VMs into a Virtual Machine Scale Set

microsoft.compute/virtualmachinescaleset.Title: Deploy a VM Scale Set with a Linux custom image
microsoft.compute/virtualmachinescaleset.Description: This template allows you to deploy a custom VM Linux image inside an Scale Set. These VMs are behind a load balancer with HTTP load balancing (by default on port 80). The example uses a custom script to do the application deployment and update, you may have to provide your custom script for your own update procedure. You will have to provide a generalized image of your VM in the same subscription and region where you create the VMSS.

microsoft.network/loadbalancers/inboundn.Title: Barracuda Web Application Firewall with Backend IIS Servers
microsoft.network/loadbalancers/inboundn.Description: This Azure quickstart template deploys a Barracuda Web Application Firewall Solution on Azure with required number of backend Windows 2012 based IIS Web Servers.Templates includes latest Barracuda WAF with Pay as you go license and latest Windows 2012 R2 Azure Image for IIS.The Barracuda Web Application Firewall inspects inbound web traffic and blocks SQL injections, Cross-Site Scripting, malware uploads & application DDoS and other attacks targeted at your web applications. One External LB is deployed with NAT rules to enable Remote desktop access to backend web servers. Please follow post deployment configuration guide available in GitHub template directory to learn more about post deployment steps related to Barracuda web application firewall and web applications publishing.

The cluster definition is very similar to (in many cases the same as) the ARM template syntax used to deploy a Microsoft Azure Container Service cluster.

There are also options to deploy an Azure Key Vault instance, an Azure SQL Database, and an Azure Event Hub (for streaming use cases). The second leg of the pipeline pulls data from orc files in Azure Data Lake Store and inserts into Azure SQL as a final destination. This pipeline can be easily customized to accomodated a wide variety of additional sources and targets.

microsoft.network/routetables.Title: VNS3 network appliance for cloud connectivity and security
microsoft.network/routetables.Description: VNS3 is a software only virtual appliance that provides the combined features and functions of a security appliance, application delivery controller and unified threat management device at the cloud application edge. Key benefits, on top of cloud networking, always on end to end encryption, federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, attestable control over encryption keys, meshed network manageable at scale, reliable HA in the cloud, isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, caching, proxy, load balancers and other layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.

microsoft.documentdb/databaseaccounts.Title: Create a Cosmos DB account with Microsoft Defender enabled
microsoft.documentdb/databaseaccounts.Description: Using this ARM template, you can deploy an Azure Cosmos DB account with Microsoft Defender for Azure Cosmos DB enabled. Microsoft Defender for Azure Cosmos DB is an Azure-native layer of security that detects attempts to exploit databases in your Azure Cosmos DB accounts. Microsoft Defender for Azure Cosmos DB detects potential SQL injections, known bad actors based on Microsoft Threat Intelligence, suspicious access patterns, and potential exploitations of your database through compromised identities or malicious insiders.

microsoft.datamigration/services/project.Title: Migrate to Azure SQL database using Azure DMS
microsoft.datamigration/services/project.Description: The Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) is designed to streamline the process of migrating on-premises databases to Azure. DMS will simplify the migration of existing on-premises SQL Server and Oracle databases to Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance or Microsoft SQL Server in an Azure Virtual Machine. This template would deploy an instance of Azure Database Migration service, an Azure VM with SQL server installed on it which will act as a Source server with pre created database on it and a Target Azure SQL DB server which will have a pre-created schema of the database to be migrated from Source to Target server. The template will also deploy the required resources like NIC, vnet etc for supporting the Source VM, DMS service and Target server.

microsoft.network/virtualnetworks/subnet.Title: Multi-client VNS3 network appliance
microsoft.network/virtualnetworks/subnet.Description: VNS3 is a software only virtual appliance that provides the combined features and functions of a Security Appliance, Application Delivery Controller and Unified Threat Management device at the cloud application edge. Key benefits, On top of cloud networking, Always on end to end encryption, Federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, Attestable control over encryption keys, Meshed network manageable at scale, Reliable HA in the Cloud, Isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), Segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, Caching, Proxy Load Balancers and other Layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.

Key benefits, on top of cloud networking, always on end to end encryption, federate data centres, cloud regions, cloud providers, and/or containers, creating one unified address space, attestable control over encryption keys, meshed network manageable at scale, reliable HA in the cloud, isolate sensitive applications (fast low cost Network Segmentation), segmentation within applications, Analysis of all data in motion in the cloud. Key network functions; virtual router, switch, firewall, vpn concentrator, multicast distributor, with plugins for WAF, NIDS, caching, proxy, load balancers and other layer 4 thru 7 network functions, VNS3 doesn't require new knowledge or training to implement, so you can integrate with existing network equipment.
